analyzed: paśoḥ api ca kartṛ tvam patyuḥ preraṇa pūrvakam
translated: And the animal also is the doer, preceded by the lord's instigation.

analyzed: ayathā karaṇa jñānam aṃdhasya gamanam yathā
translated: Like the blind man's going without the knowledge of how to do it.

original: ātmānaṃ ca pṛthaṅmatvā preritāraṃ tataḥ pṛthak // / / //
analyzed: ātmānam ca pṛthak matvā preritāram tatas pṛthak
translated: Having known the self separately, and then the instigator separately,

analyzed: asau juṣṭaḥ tatas tena hi amṛta tvāya kalpate  /
translated: He is accepted, and therefore he is fit for immortality.

original: paśoḥ pāśasya patyuśca tattvato 'sti padaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: paśoḥ pāśasya patyuḥ ca tattvataḥ sti padam param
translated: Of the animal, the fetter, and the lord, there is a supreme state in reality.

analyzed: brahma vid tat viditvā eva yoni muktaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Having known that, one who knows Brahman will be liberated from the womb.

analyzed: saṃyuktam etat dvitayam kṣaram akṣaram eva ca
translated: This pair is united, the perishable and the imperishable.

analyzed: vyakta avyaktam bibharti īśaḥ viśvam viśva vimocakaḥ
translated: The lord, the revealer of the manifest and the unmanifest, supports the universe, the liberator of the universe.

original: bhoktā bhogyaṃ prerayitā maṃtavyaṃ trividhaṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: bhoktā bhogyam prerayitā maṃtavyam trividham smṛtam
translated: The enjoyer, the object of enjoyment, the instigator, the object of thought, is remembered as threefold.

original: nātaḥ paraṃ vijānadbhirveditavyaṃ hi kiṃcanaḥ // / / //🔽tileṣu vā yathā tailaṃ dadhni vā sarpirarpitam // / / //
analyzed: na atas param vijānadbhiḥ veditavyam hi kiṃcanaḥ  tileṣu vā yathā tailam dadhni vā sarpiḥ arpitam
translated: Beyond this, nothing else should be known by those who know.🔽Just as oil is in sesame seeds, or ghee is in curd,

analyzed: yathā āpaḥ srotasi vyāptāḥ yathā araṇyām hutāśanaḥ
translated: Just as water pervades a stream, just as a sacrificial fire is in the forest,

analyzed: evam eva mahātmānam ātmani ātma vilakṣaṇam
translated: In the same way, one sees the great soul, which is different from the individual soul,

analyzed: satyena tapasā ca eva nitya yuktaḥ nupaśyati
translated: By truth and austerity, always united, one sees him who is to be seen.

analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ jālavān īśaḥ īśānībhiḥ sva śaktibhiḥ
translated: He who is alone, the lord with nets, with his own powers, the goddesses,

original: sarvāṃllokānimān kṛtvā eka eva sa īśate // / / //
analyzed: sarvān lokān imān kṛtvā ekaḥ eva saḥ īśate  /
translated: Having created all these worlds, he alone rules.

original: eka eva tadā rudro na dvitīyo 'sti kaścana // / / //
analyzed: ekaḥ eva tadā rudraḥ na dvitīyaḥ sti kaścana
translated: At that time, Rudra is alone, there is no second at all.

original: saṃsṛjya viśvabhuvanaṃ goptā te saṃcukoca yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃsṛjya viśva bhuvanam goptā te saṃcukoca yaḥ
translated: Having created the universe, he who is the protector, has contracted himself.

analyzed: śap luk abhāve ārṣa
translated: The state of being a wolf is archaic.

analyzed: viśvatas cakṣuḥ eva ayam uta ayam viśvatomukhaḥ
translated: He is indeed the all-seeing one, and he is the all-faced one.

analyzed: tathā eva viśvatobāhu viśvatas pāda saṃyutaḥ
translated: In the same way, he is the all-armed one, endowed with all-feet.

original: dyāvābhūmī ca janayan deva eko maheśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: dyāvābhūmī ca janayan devaḥ ekaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: Generating heaven and earth, the one god Maheshvara.

analyzed: saḥ eva sarva devānām prabhavaḥ ca udbhavaḥ tathā
translated: He alone is the origin and source of all gods.

original: hiraṇyagarbhaṃ devānāṃ prathamaṃ janayedayam // / / //🔽viśvasmādadhiko rudro maharṣiriti hi śrutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇya garbham devānām prathamam janayet ayam  viśvasmāt adhikaḥ rudraḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ iti hi śrutiḥ
translated: This one would first generate Hiranyagarbha of the gods.🔽The sacred knowledge says that Rudra is superior to the universe, the great sage.

analyzed: veda aham etam puruṣam mahāṃtam amṛtam dhruvam
translated: I know this great, immortal, and stable person.

analyzed: āditya varṇam tamasaḥ parastāt saṃsthitam prabhum
translated: The lord who is stationed beyond darkness, having the complexion of the sun.

analyzed: asmāt nā asti param kiṃcid aparam paramātmanaḥ
translated: There is nothing greater than Him, nothing else but the Supreme Self.

original: nāṇīyo 'sti na ca jyāyastena pūrṇamidaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: na aṇīyaḥ sti na ca jyāyaḥ tena pūrṇam idam jagat
translated: There is nothing smaller than Him, nothing greater than Him. By Him, this universe is filled.

analyzed: sarva ānana śiraḥ grīvaḥ sarva bhūta guhā āśayaḥ
translated: He who has faces, heads, and necks everywhere, who is the abode of the hearts of all beings,

analyzed: sarvavyāpī ca bhagavān tasmāt sarva gataḥ śivaḥ
translated: The illustrious one who pervades everything, therefore He is all-pervading and auspicious.

analyzed: sarvatas pāṇi pādaḥ yam kṣi śiraḥ mukhaḥ
translated: He who has hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and faces everywhere,

analyzed: sarvatas śrutimān loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati
translated: He who has ears everywhere in the world, stands pervading everything.

analyzed: sarva indriya guṇa ābhāsaḥ sarva indriya vivarjitaḥ
translated: He who is the manifestation of the qualities of all senses, yet is devoid of all senses,

analyzed: sarvasya prabhuḥ īśānaḥ sarvasya śaraṇam suhṛd
translated: The lord and master of all, the refuge and friend of all.

analyzed: a cakṣuḥ api yaḥ paśyati a karṇaḥ u pi śṛṇoti yaḥ
translated: He who sees without eyes, hears without ears,

original: sarvaṃ vetti na vettāsya tamāhuḥ puruṣaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: sarvam vetti na vettā asya tam āhuḥ puruṣam param
translated: He who knows everything, yet is not known by anyone, they call Him the Supreme Person.

analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyān mahataḥ mahīyān ayam avyayaḥ
translated: Smaller than the smallest, greater than the greatest, He is the imperishable one.

analyzed: guhāyām nihitaḥ ca api jaṃtoḥ asya maheśvaraḥ
translated: And Maheshvara is hidden in the cave of this living being.

analyzed: tam akratum kratu prāyam mahima atiśaya anvitam
translated: That one who is beyond the reach of thought, who is full of thought, and who is endowed with greatness and excellence.

analyzed: dhātuḥ prasādāt īśānam vīta śokaḥ prapaśyati
translated: The one who is free from sorrow sees the Lord, the most auspicious one, through the grace of the Creator.

analyzed: veda aham enam ajaram purāṇam sarvagam vibhum
translated: I know this unborn, ancient, all-pervading, and powerful one.

analyzed: nirodham janmanaḥ yasya vadaṃti brahma vādinaḥ
translated: The expounders of Brahman say that he is the one whose birth is stopped.

original: eko 'pi trīnimāṃllokān bahudhā śaktiyogataḥ // / / //🔽vidadhāti vicetyaṃte viśvamādau maheśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekaḥ pi trīn imān lokān bahudhā śakti yogataḥ  vidadhāti viśvam ādau maheśvaraḥ
translated: Even alone, he creates these three worlds in many ways through the union of his powers.🔽At the beginning, Maheshvara creates the universe, which is to be known, and at the end, he dissolves it back into himself.

original: viśvadhātrītyajākhyā ca śaivī citrā kṛtiḥ parā // / / //
analyzed: viśvadhātrī iti ajā ākhyā ca śaivī citrā kṛtiḥ parā
translated: The great and wonderful creation of Shiva is known as Ajā, the mother of the universe.

original: tāmajāṃ lohitāṃ śuklāṃ kṛṣṇāmekāṃ tvajaḥ prajām // / / //🔽janitrīmanuśete 'nyojuṣamāṇassvarūpiṇīm // / / //
analyzed: tām ajām lohitām śuklām kṛṣṇām ekām tu ajaḥ prajām  janitrīm anuśete nyojuṣamāṇaḥ svarūpiṇīm
translated: The unborn one lies on that unborn, red, white, and black single creation.🔽The other one, enjoying his own form, lies down with the mother who gives birth.

analyzed: tām eva ajām ajaḥ nyastu bhakta bhogāḥ jahāti ca
translated: But the other unborn one abandons that unborn one, who enjoys the devotion of the devotees.

original: dvau suparṇau ca sayujau samānaṃ vṛkṣamāsthitau // / / //
analyzed: dvau suparṇau ca sayujau samānam vṛkṣam āsthitau
translated: The two birds, yoked together, are seated on the same tree.

analyzed: ekaḥ tti pippalam svādu paraḥ na aśnan prapaśyati
translated: One eats the sweet fig, the other, not eating, looks on.

analyzed: vṛkṣe ismin puruṣaḥ magnaḥ guhyamānaḥ ca śocati
translated: In this tree, a man is immersed, hidden and sorrowful.

analyzed: juṣṭam anyam yadā paśyet īśam parama kāraṇam
translated: When one sees another Lord, the supreme cause, as the beloved one,

analyzed: tadā asya mahimānam ca vīta śokaḥ sukhī bhavet
translated: then one becomes free from sorrow and happy, and one would attain his greatness.

original: chaṃdāṃsi yajñāḥ ṛtavo yadbhūtaṃ bhavyameva ca // / / //
analyzed: chaṃdāṃsi yajñāḥ ṛtavaḥ yat bhūtam bhavyam eva ca
translated: The Vedas, sacrifices, and the seasons, and whatever exists and will exist,

analyzed: māyī viśvam sṛjati asmin niviṣṭaḥ māyayā paraḥ
translated: the Supreme One, who is the magician, creates the universe in this (world) by means of His Maya.

original: māyāṃ tu prakṛtiṃ vidyānmāyinaṃ tu maheśvaram // / / //
analyzed: māyām tu prakṛtim vidyāt māyinam tu maheśvaram
translated: But one should know Maya as Prakriti, and Mahesvara as the magician.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tu avayavaiḥ eva vyāptam sarvam idam jagat
translated: And by His parts, this entire world is pervaded.

analyzed: sūkṣma ati sūkṣmam īśānam kalalasya api madhyatas
translated: The Lord, who is subtler than the subtle, is situated even in the middle of the embryo.

analyzed: vicetā iti prayogaḥ tu ārṣa tvena
translated: The use of the word 'vicetas' is Vedic.

original: vyatyayo bahulam' iti smaraṇena sādhuḥ🔽sraṣṭāramapi viśvasya veṣṭitāraṃ ca tasya tu // / / //
analyzed: vyatyayaḥ bahulam iti smaraṇena sādhuḥ  sraṣṭāram api viśvasya veṣṭitāram ca tasya tu
translated: It is correct by the Smriti rule 'vyatyayo bahulam'.🔽Having known Shiva alone as the creator and the protector of the universe,

analyzed: śivam eva īśvaram jñātvā śāṃtim atyaṃtam ṛcchati
translated: one attains supreme peace.

original: sa eva kālo goptā ca viśvasyādhipatiḥ prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva kālaḥ goptā ca viśvasya adhipatiḥ prabhuḥ
translated: He alone is the protector and the lord of the universe.

analyzed: tam viśva adhipatim jñātvā mṛtyu pāśāt pramucyate
translated: Having known Him as the lord of the universe, one is freed from the noose of death.

original: ghṛtātparaṃ maṃḍamiva sūkṣmaṃ jñātvā sthitaṃ prabhum // / / //
analyzed: ghṛtāt param maṃḍam iva sūkṣmam jñātvā sthitam prabhum
translated: Having known the Lord, who is subtler than butter, as situated,

analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu gūḍham ca sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: And hidden in all beings, one is freed from all sins.

original: eṣa eva paro devo viśvakarmā maheśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva paraḥ devaḥ viśvakarmā maheśvaraḥ
translated: This alone is the supreme god, the all-creator, the great lord.

analyzed: hṛdaye saṃniviṣṭam tam jñātvā eva amṛtam aśnute
translated: Having known him residing in the heart, one attains immortality.

original: yadā samastaṃ na divā na rātrirna sadapyasat // / / //
analyzed: yadā samastam na divā na rātriḥ na sat api asat
translated: When everything is neither day nor night, neither existent nor non-existent,

analyzed: kevalaḥ śivaḥ eva ekaḥ yatas prajñā purātanī
translated: Then only Shiva is alone, since wisdom is ancient.

original: nainamūrdhvaṃ na tiryakca na madhyaṃ paryajigrahat // / / //
analyzed: na enam ūrdhvam na tiryak ca na madhyam paryajigrahat
translated: He was not grasped above, nor across, nor in the middle.

original: na tasya pratimā cāsti yasya nāma mahadyaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tasya pratimā ca asti yasya nāma mahat yaśaḥ
translated: He has no image, whose name is great fame.

analyzed: ajātam imam eva eke buddhāḥ janmani bhīravaḥ
translated: Some, fearing birth, consider this unborn one to be born.

analyzed: rudrasya asya prapadyante rakṣā artham dakṣiṇam sukham
translated: They resort to this Rudra's right side for protection and happiness.

analyzed: dve akṣare brahma pare tu anaṃte samudāhṛte
translated: Two syllables are declared to be beyond Brahman, in the infinite.

analyzed: vidyā avidye samākhyāte nihite yatra gūḍha vat
translated: Knowledge and ignorance are called, as if hidden, where they are placed.

analyzed: kṣaram tu avidyā hi amṛtam vidyā iti parigīyate
translated: The perishable is said to be ignorance, the imperishable to be knowledge.

original: te ubhe īśate yastu so 'nyaḥ khalu maheśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: te ubhe īśate yaḥ tu saḥ nyaḥ khalu maheśvaraḥ
translated: He who rules over both of them is indeed another Maheshvara.

analyzed: ekaikam bahudhā jālam vikurvan eka vat ca yaḥ
translated: Who, transforming each into many nets, as if into one,

analyzed: sarva ādhipatyam kurute sṛṣṭvā sarvān pratāpavān
translated: Having created all, the powerful one exercises sovereignty over all.

analyzed: diśaḥ ūrdhvam adhas tiryak bhāsayan bhrājate svayam
translated: Shining upwards, downwards and sideways, he himself shines.

analyzed: yaḥ niḥsvabhāvāt api ekaḥ vareṇyaḥ tu adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Who, though without intrinsic nature, is the one to be chosen, he presides.

analyzed: svabhāva vācakān sarvān vācyān ca pariṇāmayan
translated: Transforming all the words expressing intrinsic nature and the things to be expressed,

analyzed: guṇān ca bhogya bhoktṛ tve tat viśvam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And the qualities in the state of enjoyer and enjoyed, he presides over that universe.

original: te vai guhyopaṇiṣadi gūḍhaṃ brahma parātparam // / / //
analyzed: te vai guhya upaṇiṣadi gūḍham brahma parātparam
translated: They know that in the secret Upanishad, the Brahman is hidden, higher than the high.

analyzed: brahma yonim jagat pūrvam viduḥ devāḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The gods and the great sages know the Brahman as the source of the world.

analyzed: bhāva grāhyam anīha ākhyam bhāva abhāva karam śivam
translated: To be grasped by the mind, called desireless, the cause of existence and non-existence, auspicious,

analyzed: kalā sarga karam devam ye viduḥ te jahuḥ tanum
translated: Those who know the god who brings about the creation by parts, they have abandoned the body.

analyzed: svabhāvam eke manyaṃte kālam eke vimohitāḥ
translated: Some consider it to be intrinsic nature, others, deluded, consider it to be time.

original: devasya mahimā hyeṣa yenedaṃ bhrāmyate jagat // / / //
analyzed: devasya mahimā hi eṣa yena idam bhrāmyate jagat
translated: This is the greatness of the god by which this world is deluded.

analyzed: yena idam āvṛtam nityam kāla kāla ātmanā yatas
translated: Since it is always covered by the form of time and death,

analyzed: tena īritam idam karma bhūtaiḥ saha vivartate
translated: By that, this action is impelled and evolves along with the elements.

original: tatkarma bhūyaśaḥ kṛtvā vinivṛtya ca bhūyaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat karma bhūyaśas kṛtvā vinivṛtya ca bhūyaśas
translated: Having performed that action many times and having turned back many times,

original: tattvasya saha tattvena yogaṃ cāpi sametya vai // / / //
analyzed: tattvasya saha tattvena yogam ca api sametya vai
translated: And having also attained union with reality along with reality,

original: aṣṭābhiśca tribhiścaivaṃ dvābhyāṃ caikena vā punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: aṣṭābhiḥ ca tribhiḥ ca evam dvābhyām ca ekena vā punar
translated: And also by eight, three, two, or even one,

analyzed: kālena ātma guṇaiḥ ca api kṛtsnam eva jagat svayam
translated: And by time and one's own qualities, one's own entire world,

analyzed: guṇaiḥ ārabhya karmāṇi svabhāva ādīni yojayet
translated: Having begun with the qualities, one should connect the actions with nature and so on.

analyzed: teṣām abhāve nāśaḥ syāt kṛtasya api ca karmaṇaḥ
translated: In their absence, there would be destruction even of the performed action.

analyzed: karma kṣaye punar ca anyat tatas yāti sa tattvataḥ
translated: And again, due to the exhaustion of action, he goes to another one from that, in reality.

original: sa evādissvayaṃ yoganimittaṃ bhoktṛbhogayoḥ // / / //🔽parastrikālādakalassa eva parameśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva ādiḥ svayam yoga nimittam bhoktṛ bhogayoḥ  / paraḥ tri kālāt akalaḥ saḥ eva parameśvaraḥ
translated: He alone is the beginning, the cause of union for the enjoyer and the enjoyed,🔽He alone is the supreme Lord, beyond the three times, without parts.
The omniscient one, the lord of the three qualities, Brahman himself, greater than the greatest,

analyzed: tam viśvarūpam abhavam bhavam īḍyam prajāpatim
translated: We worship that Prajapati, who is the universe, who is the unborn, who is to be worshipped by the gods,

analyzed: devadevam jagat pūjyam sva citta stham upāsmahe
translated: The god of gods, worshipped by the world, who resides in one's own mind.

analyzed: kāla ādibhiḥ paraḥ yasmāt prapañcaḥ parivartate
translated: From whom the universe revolves due to time and other factors.

analyzed: dharma āvaham pāpa nudam bhoga īśam viśva dhāma ca
translated: The bestower of virtue, the remover of sin, the lord of enjoyments, the abode of the universe.

original: tamīśvarāṇāṃ paramaṃ maheśvaraṃ taṃ devatānāṃ paramaṃ ca daivatam // / / //
analyzed: tam īśvarāṇām paramam maheśvaram tam devatānām paramam ca daivatam
translated: Him, the supreme lord of lords, the supreme deity of deities,

original: patiṃ patīnāṃ paramaṃ parastādvidāma devaṃ bhuvaneśvareśvaram // / / //
analyzed: patim patīnām paramam parastāt vidāma devam bhuvaneśvara īśvaram
translated: The supreme lord of lords, we know as the god, the lord of the lord of the world.

original: na tasya vidyeta kāryaṃ kāraṇaṃ ca na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: na tasya vidyeta kāryam kāraṇam ca na vidyate
translated: He has no effect, and no cause exists for him.

analyzed: na tad samaḥ dhikaḥ ca api kvacid jagati dṛśyate
translated: Nowhere in the world is he seen to be equal or superior.

original: parāsya vividhā śaktiḥ śrutau svābhāvikī śrutā // / / //
analyzed: parā asya vividhā śaktiḥ śrutau svābhāvikī śrutā
translated: His various powers are heard in the Vedas as inherent.

original: jñānaṃ balaṃ kriyā caiva yābhyo viśvamidaṃ kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: jñānam balam kriyā ca eva yābhyaḥ viśvam idam kṛtam
translated: Knowledge, strength, and action - from which this universe is created.

original: tasyāsti patiḥ kaścinnaiva liṃgaṃ na ceśitā // / / //
analyzed: tasya asti patiḥ kaścid nā eva liṃgam na ca īśitā
translated: He has no husband, no linga, and is not controlled by anyone.

analyzed: kāraṇam kāraṇānām ca sa teṣām adhipa adhipaḥ
translated: He is the cause of causes and the lord of their lords.

original: na cāsya janitā kaścinna ca janma kutaścana // / / //
analyzed: na ca asya janitā kaścid na ca janma kutaścana
translated: No one is his progenitor, and he has no birth from anywhere.

analyzed: na janma hetavaḥ tadvat mala māyā ādi saṃjñakāḥ
translated: The causes of birth, such as impurity, illusion, and so on, are not his.

analyzed: saḥ ekaḥ sarva bhūteṣu gūḍhaḥ vyāptaḥ ca viśvatas
translated: He is one, hidden in all beings, and pervades everything.

analyzed: sarva bhūta aṃtarātmā ca dharma adhyakṣaḥ sa kathyate
translated: He is said to be the overseer of Dharma, the inner soul of all beings.

analyzed: sarva bhūta adhivāsaḥ ca sākṣī cetā ca nirguṇaḥ
translated: He is the abode of all beings, the witness, the mind, and devoid of qualities.

analyzed: ekaḥ vaśī niṣkriyāṇām bahūnām vivaśa ātmanām
translated: He is the one controller of many beings who are powerless and inactive.

analyzed: nityānām api asau nityaḥ cetanānām ca cetanaḥ
translated: He is eternal among the eternal, and the conscious one among the conscious.

analyzed: ekaḥ bahūnām ca akāmaḥ kāmān īśaḥ prayacchati
translated: He is the one who grants desires to many who are desireless.

analyzed: sāṃkhya yoga adhigamyam yatkāraṇam jagatām patim
translated: He is the cause that is to be attained through Sāṃkhya and Yoga, the lord of the worlds.

original: jñātvā devaṃ paśuḥ pāśaissarvaireva vimucyate // / / //🔽viśvakṛdviśvavitsvātmayonijñaḥ kālakṛdguṇī // / / //
analyzed: jñātvā devam paśuḥ pāśaiḥ sarvaiḥ eva vimucyate
translated: Knowing that God, an animal is freed from all the bonds.🔽The creator of the universe, the knower of the universe, born of his own nature, the measurer of time, the virtuous one,
The foremost, the lord of the individual souls, the lord of the qualities, the liberator from bondage.

analyzed: brahmāṇam vidadhe pūrvam vedān ca upādiśat svayam
translated: He created Brahmā first and himself taught the Vedas.

analyzed: yaḥ devaḥ tam aham buddhvā sva ātma buddhi prasādataḥ

analyzed: aṣṭamaḥ nugrahaḥ sargaḥ kaumāraḥ navamaḥ smṛtaḥ

analyzed: prākṛtāḥ ca trayaḥ pūrve sargāḥ te buddhi pūrvakāḥ

analyzed: buddhi pūrvam pravartante mukhya ādyāḥ pañca vaikṛtāḥ

original: agre sasarja vai brahmā mānasānātmanaḥ samān // / / //

analyzed: sanandam sanakam ca eva vidvāṃsam ca sanātanam
translated: Sananda, Sanaka, and the wise Sanatana,

analyzed: ṛbhum sanatkumārañca pūrvam eva prajāpatiḥ

analyzed: teṣu sṛṣṭi anapekṣeṣu gateṣu sanaka ādiṣu

analyzed: tasya evam tapyamānasya na kiṃcid samavartata
translated: Even as he was thus practicing austerity, nothing happened.

analyzed: tatas dīrgheṇa kālena duḥkhāt krodhaḥ vyajāyata

analyzed: krodha āviṣṭasya netrābhyām prāpatan aśru bindavaḥ

analyzed: tatas tebhyaḥ śru bindubhyaḥ bhūtāḥ pretāḥ tadā abhavan

analyzed: sarvān tān aśru jān dṛṣṭvā brahmā ātmānam aniṃdata

analyzed: tasya tīvrā bhavat mūrchā krodha amarṣa samudbhavā

analyzed: mūrchitaḥ tu jahau prāṇān krodha āviṣṭaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: Overcome by anger, Prajapati gave up his life.

analyzed: tatas prāṇeśvaraḥ rudraḥ bhagavān nīlalohitaḥ
translated: Then Lord Rudra, the blue-red one, the lord of life,

analyzed: prasādam atulam kartum prādurāsīt prabhoḥ mukhāt

analyzed: daśadhā ca ekadhā cakre sva ātmānam prabhuḥ īśvaraḥ

analyzed: tasmāt sarvasya lokasya sthāpanāya hitāya ca

analyzed: prajā santāna hetoḥ ca prayatadhvam atandritāḥ

analyzed: evam uktāḥ ca ruruduḥ dudruvuḥ ca samantataḥ

analyzed: rodanāt drāvaṇāt ca eva te rudrāḥ nāmataḥ smṛtāḥ

analyzed: ye rudrāḥ te khalu prāṇāḥ ye prāṇāḥ te mahātmakāḥ  tatas mṛtasya devasya brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: Those who are Rudras are indeed the vital breaths, and those who are vital breaths are the great souls.🔽Then, of the dead god Brahma, the supreme lord,

analyzed: svapna anubhūtam iva tat śrutvā vākyam manoharam

analyzed: aṃgahāra svasena idam asakṛt cālitam jagat
translated: This world was repeatedly shaken by the dance movements of the army.

analyzed: śāntaḥ eva sadā sarvam anugṛhṇāti ced śivaḥ
translated: If Shiva, who is always peaceful, favors everything,

analyzed: sarvāṇi pūrayet eva katham śaktena mocayet

analyzed: anādi karma vaicitryam api na atra niyāmakam

analyzed: kāraṇam khalu karma api bhavet īśvara kāritam

analyzed: kim atra bahunā uktena nāstikyam hetu kārakam
translated: What is the use of speaking much in this matter? Atheism is the cause of downfall.

original: yathā hyāśu nivarteta tathā kathaya māruta // / / //🔽iti śrīśivamahāpurāṇe saptamyāṃ vāyavīyasaṃhitāyāṃ pūrvakhaṇḍe śivatattvapraśno nāma triṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: yathā hi āśu nivarteta tathā kathaya māruta  iti śrī śiva mahāpurāṇe saptamyām vāyavīyasaṃhitāyām pūrva khaṇḍe śivatattvapraśnaḥ nāma triṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: O Wind, please tell me how one can quickly turn away from this.

analyzed: chapter
translated: Thus ends the Thirtieth Chapter, in the First Book, of the Vayu-Samhita of the Shivapurana, composed by the great sage Krishna Dvaipayana Vedavyasa.🔽The First Book of the Vayu Purana, called the Vayavya Khanda, is completed.

analyzed: vāyuḥ uvāca
translated: Vayu said:

analyzed: sthane saṃśayitam viprāḥ bhavadbhiḥ hetu coditaiḥ
translated: O Brahmins, you have asked with doubt-provoking reasons.

analyzed: jijñāsā hi na nāstikyam sādhayet sādhu buddhiṣu
translated: Inquiry does not lead to atheism in the minds of the virtuous.

analyzed: pramaṇam atra vakṣyāmi satām moha nivartakam
translated: I will state the means of valid knowledge here, which removes the delusion of the good.

original: asatāṃ tvanyathābhāvaḥ prasādena vinā prabhoḥ // / / //🔽śivasya paripūrṇasya parānugrahamantarā // / / //
analyzed: asatām tu anyathābhāvaḥ prasādena vinā prabhoḥ  śivasya paripūrṇasya para anugraham antarā
translated: But for the wicked, it is otherwise, without the grace of the Lord.🔽For Shiva, who is perfect, there is nothing to be done without showing grace to others.

analyzed: na kiṃcid api kartavyam iti sādhu viniścitam
translated: This is well ascertained.

analyzed: svabhāvaḥ eva paryāptaḥ para anugraha karmaṇi
translated: His very nature is sufficient for the act of showing grace to others.

analyzed: anyathā nissvabhavena na kim api anugṛhyate
translated: Otherwise, by one without nature, nothing is shown grace.

analyzed: param sarvam anugrāhyam paśu pāśa ātmakam jagat
translated: The entire world, consisting of the bound souls and the bonds, is to be shown grace.

analyzed: parasya anugraha artham tu patyuḥ ājñā samanvayaḥ
translated: But the connection with the command of the Lord is for the grace of others.

analyzed: patiḥ ājñāpakaḥ sarvam anugṛhṇāti sarvadā
translated: The Lord is the commander and always favors everything.

analyzed: tad artham artha svīkāre parataṃtraḥ katham śivaḥ
translated: How can Śiva be dependent on others in accepting the object for that purpose?

analyzed: anugrāhi anapekṣaḥ sti na hi kaścid anugrahaḥ
translated: There is no grace at all that is independent of the one to be favored.

analyzed: atas svātantrya śabdārtha an anapekṣa tva lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word independence is the characteristic of non-dependence.

analyzed: etat punar anugrāhyam parataṃtram tat iṣyate
translated: Moreover, that which is to be favored is considered to be dependent on others.

analyzed: anugrahāt ṛte tasya bhukti muktyoḥ ananvayāt
translated: Because enjoyment and liberation are not connected for him without grace.

analyzed: pi anugrāhyā śiva ajñāna nivartanāt
translated: Even the embodied self is to be favored, because of the removal of Śiva's ignorance.

analyzed: ajñāna dhiṣṭhitam śambhoḥ na kiṃcid iha vidyate
translated: There is nothing here that is governed by ignorance in Śambhu.

analyzed: yena upalabhyate smābhiḥ sakalena api niṣkalaḥ
translated: He by whom we perceive the formless even with the embodied,

analyzed: sa mūrti ātmā śivaḥ śaiva mūrtiḥ iti upacaryate
translated: That Śiva, the embodied self, is figuratively called the Śaiva form.

analyzed: na hi asau niṣkalaḥ sākṣāt śivaḥ parama kāraṇam
translated: For he is not directly the formless Śiva, the supreme cause.

analyzed: sa ākāreṇa anubhāvena kena api anupalakṣitaḥ
translated: Not perceived by any manifest manifestation.
The mere accessibility by means of valid knowledge is the proof of his nature.

analyzed: na tāvatā atrā upekṣā dhīḥ upalakṣaṇam aṃtarā
translated: It is not that indifference towards it is proper without a proper understanding.

analyzed: ātma upama ulvaṇam sākṣāt mūrtiḥ eva hi kācana
translated: It is indeed a certain form itself, intense like one's own self, directly.

analyzed: śivasya mūrtiḥ mūrti ātmā paraḥ tasya upalakṣaṇam
translated: The form of Śiva is the embodied self, and the supreme is its indication.

analyzed: yathā kāṣṭheṣu an ārūḍhaḥ na vahniḥ upalabhyate
translated: Just as fire is not perceived when not mounted on firewood,

original: evaṃ śivo 'pi mūrtyātmanyanārūḍha iti sthitiḥ // / / //🔽yathāgnimānayetyukte jvalatkāṣṭhādṛte svayam // / / //
analyzed: evam mūrti ātmani anārūḍhaḥ iti sthitiḥ  yathā agnim ānaya iti ukte jvalat kāṣṭhāt ṛte svayam
translated: so it is established that Śiva is not mounted on the embodied self.🔽Just as when it is said bring the fire, the fire itself is not brought apart from the burning firewood,

analyzed: na agniḥ ānīyate tadvat pūjyaḥ mūrti ātmanā śivaḥ
translated: in the same way, Śiva is to be worshipped through the embodied self.

analyzed: atas eva hi pūjā ādau mūrti ātma parikalpanam
translated: For this very reason, in worship and other rites, the embodied self is imagined.

original: mūrtyātmani kṛtaṃ sākṣācchiva eva kṛtaṃ yataḥ // / / //
analyzed: mūrti ātmani kṛtam sākṣāt śive eva kṛtam yatas
translated: For what is done directly to the embodied self is done to Śiva himself.

analyzed: liṃga ādau api tat kṛtyam arcāyām ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: That duty is also in the liṅga and other [forms of Śiva], especially in the image.

analyzed: tad tad mūrti ātma bhāvena smābhiḥ upāsyate

analyzed: yathā anugṛhyate saḥ pi mūrti ātmā pārameṣṭhinā
translated: Just as he is also favored by the supreme lord through the embodied self,

analyzed: tathā mūrti ātma niṣṭhena śivena paśavaḥ vayam
translated: in the same way, we are the animals of Śiva, who is devoted to the embodied self.

analyzed: loka anugrahaṇāya eva śivena parameṣṭhinā
translated: It is only for the grace of the worlds that Śiva, the supreme lord,

analyzed: sadāśiva ādayaḥ sarve mūrti ātmanaḥ adhiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Sadāśiva and all others are presided over by the embodied self.

analyzed: ātmanām eva bhogāya mokṣāya ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: For the enjoyment and especially for the liberation of the souls,

analyzed: tattva atattva svarūpeṣu mūrti ātmasu śiva anvayaḥ
translated: The connection with Śiva is in the embodied selves, which are of the nature of tattva (reality) and atattva (non-reality).

analyzed: bhogaḥ karma vipāka ātmā sukha duḥkha ātmakaḥ mataḥ
translated: Enjoyment is considered to be of the nature of the ripening of karma, consisting of pleasure and pain.

analyzed: na ca karma śivaḥ asti iti tasya bhogaḥ kimātmakaḥ
translated: And since Śiva does not have karma, what is the nature of his enjoyment?

analyzed: sarvam śivaḥ nugṛhṇāti na nigṛhṇāti kiṃcana
translated: Śiva favors everything and does not restrain anything at all.

analyzed: nigṛhṇatām tu ye doṣāḥ śive teṣām asaṃbhavāt
translated: But since the faults of those who restrain are impossible in Śiva,

analyzed: ye punar nigrahāḥ kecid brahma ādiṣu nidarśitāḥ
translated: Those restrains that are shown in Brahmā and others,

analyzed: te pi loka hitāya eva kṛtāḥ śrīkaṇṭha mūrtinā
translated: They too are done by Śrīkaṇṭha's form for the welfare of the world.

analyzed: brahmāṇḍasya ādhipatyam hi śrīkaṇṭhasya na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that Śrīkaṇṭha has lordship over the universe.

analyzed: śrīkaṇṭha ākhyām śivaḥ mūrtim krīḍatīm adhitiṣṭhati
translated: Śiva presides over the playful form called Śrīkaṇṭha.

analyzed: sa doṣāḥ eva deva ādyāḥ nigṛhītāḥ yathā uditam
translated: The gods and others who are restrained as described above are indeed faulty.

analyzed: tatas te pi vipāpmānaḥ prajāḥ ca api gata jvarāḥ
translated: Therefore, they too become sinless and the people become free from anxiety.

analyzed: nigrahaḥ pi sva rūpeṇa viduṣām na jugupsitaḥ
translated: Restraint also, in its own form, is not despised by the wise.

original: ata eva hi daṇḍyeṣu daṇḍo rājñāṃ praśasyate // / / //
analyzed: atas eva hi daṇḍyeṣu daṇḍaḥ rājñām praśasyate
translated: For this very reason, punishment of the punishable is praised for kings.

analyzed: yat siddhiḥ īśvara tvena kārya vargasya kṛtsnaśas
translated: By whose accomplishment the entire group of effects is as the Lord,

analyzed: na sa ced īśatām kuryāt jagataḥ katham īśvaraḥ

analyzed: īśa icchā ca vidhātṛ tvam vidheḥ ājñāpanam param

analyzed: ājñā vaśyam idam kuryāt na kuryāt iti śāsanam
translated: The command is the instruction that this should be done necessarily, and that should not be done.

analyzed: tad śāsana anuvarti tvam sādhu bhāvasya lakṣaṇam
translated: The characteristic of the good is the state of following that instruction.

original: viparītasamādhoḥ syānna sarvaṃ tattu dṛśyate // / / //🔽sādhu saṃrakṣaṇīyaṃ cedvinivartyamasādhu yat // / / //🔽nivartate ca sāmāderaṃte daṇḍo hi sādhanam // / / //

analyzed: hita artha lakṣaṇam ca idam daṇḍa antam anuśāsanam
translated: And this instruction ending with punishment is characterized by what is beneficial.

analyzed: atas yat viparītam tat ahitam saṃpracakṣate
translated: Therefore, they declare what is contrary to that to be harmful.

analyzed: hite sadā niṣaṇṇānām īśvarasya nidarśanam
translated: The example of the Lord is for those who are always engaged in what is beneficial.

analyzed: yat udvejayate lokan tat ayuktam pracakṣate

analyzed: sarvaḥ pi nigrahaḥ loke na ca vidveṣa pūrvakaḥ

translated: A father does not hate his son whom he disciplines by restraining.🔽One who restrains another by the path of impartiality,

analyzed: tasya api avaśyam yat kiṃcid nairghṛṇyam anuvartate
translated: in him also some kind of cruelty necessarily follows.

analyzed: anyathā na hinasti eva sa doṣān api asau parān

analyzed: hinasti ca ayam api ajñān param mādhyasthyam ācaran
translated: And he, practicing impartiality towards others, harms even the ignorant.

analyzed: tasmāt duḥkha ātmikām hiṃsām kurvāṇaḥ yaḥ sa nirghṛṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, the one who inflicts harm which has the nature of suffering is cruel.

analyzed: iti nirbaṃdhayaṃti eke niyamaḥ na iti ca apare
translated: Thus, some insist, while others say there is no such rule.

analyzed: nidāna jñasya bhiṣajaḥ rugṇaḥ hiṃsām prayuṃjataḥ
translated: For a physician who knows the causes, when inflicting harm on a patient,

analyzed: na kiṃcid api nairghṛṇyam ghṛṇā eva atra prayojikā
translated: there is not the slightest cruelty; compassion alone is the motive here.

analyzed: ghṛṇā api na guṇāya eva hiṃsreṣu pratiyogiṣu
translated: Even compassion is not a virtue towards violent opponents.

analyzed: tādṛśeṣu ghṛṇī bhrāntyā ghṛṇā antarita nirghṛṇaḥ
translated: One who is compassionate towards such people, deluded, with compassion hidden, is merciless.

analyzed: upekṣā api iha doṣā āha rakṣyeṣu pratiyogiṣu
translated: Even indifference here is a fault towards protectable opponents.

analyzed: śaktau satyām upekṣātaḥ rakṣyaḥ sadyas vipadyate
translated: When there is ability, due to indifference, the protectable one perishes immediately.

analyzed: sarpasya
translated: One who, seeing the snake in the house, neglects the protectable one,

analyzed: doṣa ābhāsān samutprekṣya phalataḥ saḥ pi nirghṛṇaḥ
translated: is also merciless, having imagined faults, from the point of view of result.

original: tasmād ghṛṇā guṇāyaiva sarvatheti na saṃmatam // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt ghṛṇā guṇāya eva sarvathā iti na saṃmatam
translated: Therefore, compassion is not accepted as a virtue in any way.

analyzed: saṃmatam prāpta kāmi tvam sarvam tu anyat asammatam
translated: Attainment of the desired is accepted, but everything else is not accepted.

analyzed: mūrti ātmasu api rāga ādyāḥ doṣāḥ santi eva vastutas
translated: Even in embodied souls, faults like attachment etc. do exist in reality.

original: tathāpi teṣāmevaite na śivasya tu sarvathā // / / //
analyzed: tathā api teṣām eva ete na śivasya tu sarvathā
translated: Still, these belong to them alone, not at all to Shiva.

original: agnāvapi samāviṣṭaṃ tāmraṃ khalu sakālikam // / / //🔽iti nāgnirasau duṣyettāmrasaṃsargakāraṇāt // / / //
analyzed: agnau api samāviṣṭam tāmram khalu sa kālikam  iti na agniḥ asau duṣyet tāmra saṃsarga kāraṇāt
translated: Even when copper is placed in fire, it becomes impure.🔽Thus, fire is not defiled due to contact with copper.

analyzed: na agneḥ aśuci saṃsargāt aśuci tvam apekṣate
translated: Fire does not require impurity due to contact with impure substances.

original: aśucestvagnisaṃyogācchucitvamapi jāyate // / / //🔽evaṃ śodhyātmasaṃsargānna hyaśuddhaḥ śivo bhavet // / / //
analyzed: aśuceḥ tu agni saṃyogāt śuci tvam api jāyate  evam śodhya ātma saṃsargāt na hi aśuddhaḥ śivaḥ bhavet
translated: Even purity arises from the contact of the impure with fire.🔽In the same way, Śiva does not become impure due to contact with the impure soul that is to be purified.

analyzed: śiva saṃsargataḥ tu eṣa śodhya ātmā eva hi śudhyati
translated: But this very soul to be purified becomes pure due to contact with Śiva.

analyzed: ayasi agnau samāviṣṭe dāhaḥ gneḥ eva na ayasaḥ
translated: When iron is placed in fire, it is the fire that burns, not the iron.

original: mūrtātmanyevamaiśvaryamīśvarasyaiva nātmanām // / / //🔽na hi kāṣṭhaṃ jvalatyūrdhvamagnireva jvalatyasau // / / //
analyzed: mūrta ātmani evam aiśvaryam īśvarasya eva na ātmanām  na hi kāṣṭham jvalati ūrdhvam agniḥ eva jvalati asau
translated: In the same way, the lordship belongs to Śiva alone, not to the embodied souls.🔽For wood does not burn upwards, it is the fire that burns.

analyzed: kāṣṭhasya aṃgāra tā na agneḥ evam atra api yojyatām
translated: The wood becomes charcoal, not the fire. This should be applied here in the same way.

analyzed: atas eva jagati asmin kāṣṭha pāṣāṇa mṛtsu api
translated: For this very reason, even in wood, stone, and clay in this world,

analyzed: śiva āveśa vaśāt eva śiva tvam upacaryate  maitrī ādayaḥ guṇāḥ gauṇāḥ tasmāt te bhinna vṛttayaḥ
translated: the state of being Śiva is attributed to them due to the influence of Śiva's presence.🔽Therefore, qualities like friendliness have a secondary meaning, they have a different function.

analyzed: taiḥ guṇaiḥ uparaktānām doṣāya ca guṇāya ca
translated: For those who are endowed with those qualities, they are both for good and for bad.

analyzed: yat tu gauṇam agauṇam ca tat sarvam anugṛhṇataḥ
translated: But for one who accepts everything, whether secondary or primary,

original: na guṇāya na doṣāya śivasya guṇavṛttayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na guṇāya na doṣāya śivasya guṇa vṛttayaḥ
translated: the qualities of Śiva are neither for good nor for bad.

analyzed: na ca anugraha śabda artham gauṇam āhuḥ vipaścitaḥ
translated: And the wise do not consider the meaning of the word anugraha (blessing) to be secondary.

analyzed: saṃsāra mocanam kim tu śaivam ājñā mayam hitam
translated: But the liberation from worldly existence is the beneficial command of Śiva.

analyzed: hitam tat ājñā karaṇam yat hitam tat anugrahaḥ
translated: The benefit is the performance of that command, and that benefit is the blessing.

analyzed: sarvam hite niyuñjāvaḥ sarva anugraha kārakaḥ
translated: We should engage everything in what is beneficial, the one who causes the blessing of all.

analyzed: yaḥ tu upakāra śabda arthaḥ tam api āhuḥ anugraham
translated: They also say that the meaning of the word upakāra (help) is anugraha (blessing).

analyzed: tasya api hita rūpa tvāt śivaḥ sarva upakārakaḥ
translated: Śiva is the benefactor of all because he has the form of what is beneficial.

original: hite sadā niyuktaṃ tu sarvaṃ cidacidātmakam // / / //
analyzed: hite sadā niyuktam tu sarvam cit acit ātmakam
translated: Everything consisting of consciousness and the insentient is always engaged in what is beneficial.

analyzed: svabhāva pratibandham tad samam na labhate hitam
translated: That benefit does not attain equality due to the restriction of its own nature.

analyzed: yathā vikāsayati eva raviḥ padmāni bhānubhiḥ
translated: Just as the sun causes the lotuses to bloom with its rays,

analyzed: samam na vikasanti eva sva svabhāva anurodhataḥ
translated: they do not bloom equally due to conforming to their own nature.

analyzed: svabhāvaḥ pi hi bhāvānām bhāvinaḥ rthasya kāraṇam
translated: The nature of things is also the cause of the future object.

original: na hi svabhāvo naśyantamarthaṃ kartṛṣu sādhayet // / / //
analyzed: na hi svabhāvaḥ naśyantam artham kartṛṣu sādhayet
translated: For nature does not accomplish an object that is being destroyed for the agents.

analyzed: suvarṇam eva na aṃgāram drāvayati agni saṃgamaḥ
translated: The contact with fire causes the melting of gold, not of charcoal.

analyzed: evam pakva malān eva mocayet na śiva parān
translated: Thus, only those whose impurities have matured are liberated, not those who are not devoted to Śiva.

original: yadyathā bhavituṃ yogyaṃ tattathā na bhavetsvayam // / / //
analyzed: yat yathā bhavitum yogyam tat tathā na bhavet svayam
translated: Whatever is fit to be, that does not itself become otherwise.

analyzed: vinā bhāvanayā kartā svatantraḥ santataḥ bhavet
translated: Without meditation, the independent agent would always be.

analyzed: svabhāva vimalaḥ yadvat sarva anugrāhakaḥ śivaḥ
translated: Just as Śiva, who is naturally pure and favors all,

analyzed: svabhāva malināḥ tadvat ātmanaḥ jīva saṃjñitāḥ
translated: so are the selves known as jīvas, naturally impure.

analyzed: anyathā saṃsaranti ete niyamāt na śivaḥ katham
translated: Otherwise, they would transmigrate, not Śiva due to the rule.

analyzed: karma māyā anubandhaḥ saṃsāraḥ kathyate budhaiḥ
translated: The wise say that his bondage to karma and māyā is called saṃsāra.

analyzed: anubandhaḥ yamasya eva na śivasya iti hetumān
translated: This bondage is of him alone, not of Śiva, thus it has a cause.

analyzed: sa hetuḥ ātmanām eva nijaḥ na āgantukaḥ malaḥ
translated: That cause is the natural impurity of the selves, not adventitious.

analyzed: āgantuka tve kasya api bhāvyam kena api hetunā
translated: If it were adventitious, someone would become so by some cause.

translated: A learned twice-born covered with ashes is immediately freed from

analyzed: varṇinaḥ ye prapadyaṃte mām an anya samāśrayāḥ

analyzed: tasmin bhaktimatām eva madīyānām tu varṇinām

analyzed: tad ājñaptena mārgeṇa varṇinaḥ mad upāśrayāḥ

analyzed: mala māyā ādi pāśebhyaḥ vimuktāḥ mad prasādataḥ

analyzed: param madīyam āsādya punarāvṛtti durlabham

analyzed: paramam mama sādharmyam prāpya nirvṛtim āyayuḥ

analyzed: tasmāt labdhvā api a labdhvā vā varṇa dharmam mayā īritam

analyzed: āśritya mama bhaktaḥ ced sva ātmanā ātmānam uddharet

analyzed: alabdha lābhaḥ eva eṣa koṭi koṭi guṇa adhikaḥ

analyzed: tasmāt me mukhataḥ labdham varṇa dharmam samācaret

analyzed: mama avatārāḥ hi śubhe yoga ācārya chalena tu

analyzed: sarva antareṣu santi ārye saṃtatiḥ ca sahasraśas  ayuktānām abuddhīnām abhaktānām sureśvari
translated: O noble lady, they exist in all the intervals, and their lineage is in thousands.🔽O Goddess of the gods, the knowledge of lineage is difficult to obtain for the uninitiated, the ignorant, and the non-devotees.

analyzed: durlabham saṃtati jñānam tatas yatnāt samāśrayet

analyzed: sā hāniḥ tat mahat chidram sa mohaḥ sāṃdha mūka tā

analyzed: yat anyatra śramam kuryāt mokṣa mārga bahiṣkṛtaḥ

analyzed: jñānam kriyā ca caryā ca yogaḥ ca iti sureśvari

analyzed: catuṣpādaḥ samākhyātaḥ mama dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ

analyzed: paśu pāśa pati jñānam jñānam iti abhidhīyate

analyzed: ṣaḍadhva śuddhiḥ vidhinā guru adhīnā kriyā ucyate

analyzed: varṇa āśrama prayuktasya mayā eva vihitasya ca

analyzed: mama arcana ādi dharmasya caryā caryā iti kathyate

analyzed: mad uktena eva mārgeṇa mayi avasthita cetasaḥ

analyzed: vṛtti aṃtara nirodhaḥ yaḥ yogaḥ iti abhidhīyate

analyzed: aśvamedha gaṇāt śreṣṭham devi citta prasādhanam
translated: O Goddess, the purification of the mind is superior to the multitude of horse sacrifices.

analyzed: mukti dam ca tathā hi etat duṣprāpyam viṣaya eṣiṇām

analyzed: vijita iṃdriya vargasya yamena niyamena ca

analyzed: pūrva pāpa haraḥ yogaḥ viraktasya eva kathyate

analyzed: vairāgyāt jāyate jñānam jñānāt yogaḥ pravartate

analyzed: yoga jñaḥ patitaḥ vā api mucyate na atra saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: dayā kāryā atha satatam ahiṃsā jñāna saṃgrahaḥ

analyzed: satyam asteyam āstikyam śraddhā ca iṃdriya nigrahaḥ

analyzed: adhyāpanam ca adhyayanam yajanam yājanam tathā
translated: Teaching, studying, performing sacrifices, officiating at sacrifices,

analyzed: dhyānam īśvara bhāvaḥ ca satatam jñāna śīla tā
translated: Meditation, devotion to God, and constant practice of knowledge,

analyzed: yaḥ evam vartate vipraḥ jñāna yogasya siddhaye

analyzed: acirāt eva vijñānam labdhvā yogam ca viṃdati

analyzed: dagdhvā deham imam jñānī kṣaṇāt jñāna agninā priye
translated: O beloved, the knower of the Self, having burnt this body in a moment by the fire of knowledge,

analyzed: prasādāt mama yoga jñaḥ karma baṃdham prahāsyati

analyzed: puṇyaḥ puṇya ātmakam karma mukteḥ tad pratibaṃdhakam

analyzed: tasmāt niyogataḥ yogī puṇya apuṇyam vivarjayet

analyzed: phala kāmanayā karma karaṇāt pratibadhyate

analyzed: na karma mātra karaṇāt tasmāt karma phalam tyajet

original: prathamaṃ karmayajñena bahiḥ sampūjya māṃ priye // / / //
analyzed: prathamam karma yajñena bahis sampūjya mām priye
translated: O beloved, having first worshipped Me externally by the sacrifice of action,

analyzed: jñāna yoga rataḥ bhūtvā paścāt yogam samabhyaset
translated: one should then practice yoga, being devoted to the yoga of knowledge.

analyzed: vidite mama yāthātmye karma yajñena dehinaḥ

analyzed: na yajaṃti hi mām yuktāḥ sama loṣṭa aśma kāṃcanāḥ

analyzed: nitya yuktaḥ muniḥ śreṣṭhaḥ mad bhaktaḥ ca samāhitaḥ
translated: The best sage, always devoted, and My devotee, being concentrated,

analyzed: jñāna yoga rataḥ yogī mama sāyujyam āpnuyāt

analyzed: atha a virakta cittāḥ ye varṇinaḥ mad upāśritāḥ
translated: Now, those who are not detached in mind, who are renunciants, who have resorted to me,

analyzed: jñāna caryā kriyāsu eva te dhikuryuḥ tad arhakāḥ

analyzed: dvidhā mad pūjanam jñeyam bāhyam ābhyaṃtaram tathā

analyzed: vāc manaḥ kāya bhedāt ca tridhā mad bhajanam viduḥ
translated: And due to the difference of speech, mind, and body, they know the service to me as threefold.

analyzed: tapaḥ karma japaḥ dhyānam jñānam vā iti anupūrvaśas

analyzed: pañcadhā kathyate sadbhiḥ tat eva bhajanam punar

analyzed: anya ātma viditam bāhyam asmad abhyarcana ādikam

analyzed: tat eva tu sva saṃvedyam ābhyaṃtaram udāhṛtam

analyzed: manomat pravaṇam cittam na manaḥ mātram ucyate

analyzed: mad nāma niratā vāṇī vāṅmatā khalu na itarā

analyzed: liṃgaiḥ mad śāsana ādiṣṭaiḥ tripuṃḍra ādibhiḥ aṃkitaḥ

analyzed: mama upacāra nirataḥ kāyaḥ kāyaḥ na ca itaraḥ

analyzed: mad arcā karma vijñeyam bāhye yāga ādinā ucyate

analyzed: mad arthe deha saṃśoṣaḥ tapaḥ kṛcchra ādi naḥ matam

analyzed: japaḥ pañcākṣara abhyāsaḥ praṇava abhyāsaḥ eva ca

analyzed: rudra adhyāya ādika abhyāsaḥ na veda adhyayana ādikam

analyzed: na ātma ādi artha samādhayaḥ

analyzed: mama āgama artha vijñānam jñānam na anya artha vedanam

analyzed: bāhye vā abhyaṃtare vā atha yatra syāt manasaḥ ratiḥ

analyzed: prāk vāsanā vaśāt devi tattva niṣṭhām samācaret

analyzed: bāhyāt ābhyaṃtaram śreṣṭham bhavet śataguṇa adhikam

analyzed: asaṃkara tvāt doṣāṇām dṛṣṭānām api asambhavāt

analyzed: śaucam ābhyaṃtaram vidyāt na bāhyam śaucam ucyate

analyzed: antar śauca vimukta ātmā śuciḥ api aśuciḥ yatas

analyzed: bāhyam ābhyaṃrtaram ca eva bhajanam bhava pūrvakam

analyzed: na bhāva rahitam devi vipralaṃbha eka kāraṇam

analyzed: bhāva eka ātmā kriyā devi mama dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ

analyzed: manasā karmaṇā vācā hi an apekṣya phalam kvacid

analyzed: phala uddeśena deveśi laghuḥ mama samāśrayaḥ

analyzed: bhāva anurūpa phala daḥ tasya api aham anindite

analyzed: phala anapekṣayā yeṣām manaḥ mad pravaṇam bhavet

analyzed: prārthayeyuḥ phalam paścāt bhaktāḥ te mama priyāḥ

analyzed: prāk saṃskāra vaśāt eva ye viciṃtya phala aphale

analyzed: mad anugrahataḥ teṣām bhāvaḥ mayi samarpitaḥ

analyzed: phalam parama nirvāṇam prayacchati balāt iva

analyzed: mahātmanām ananyānām mayi saṃnyasta cetasām

analyzed: mad bhakta jana vātsalyam pūjāyām ca anumodanam

analyzed: jyotīṃṣi ca prapaśyet vā kuryāt vā prāṇasaṃyamam  anāsanaḥ śayāne vā gacchan utthitaḥ eva vā

analyzed: ācāraḥ paramā vidyā ācāraḥ paramā gatiḥ

analyzed: paratra ca sukhī na syāt tasmāt ācāravān bhavet

analyzed: āstikaḥ ced pramāda ādyaiḥ sat ācārāt avicyutaḥ

analyzed: rahasyam anyat vakṣyāmi gopanīyam idam priye

analyzed: sat ācāra vihīnasya patitasya antyajasya ca

analyzed: anācāravatām puṃsām aviśuddha ṣaḍadhvanām

analyzed: sarva avasthām gatasya api mayi bhaktimataḥ param

analyzed: na kadācid na kasya api ripuḥ eṣa mahā manuḥ

The initiation endowed with mantra and action, preceded by the sacrificial pit and mandala,

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena guroḥ gauravam ācaret

analyzed: sarva deva ātmakaḥ ca asau sarva maṃtra mayaḥ guruḥ

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena yasya ājñām śirasā vahet

analyzed: guru ājñā pālakaḥ yasmāt jñāna saṃpattim aśnute
translated: Because one who follows the command of the guru attains the wealth of knowledge.

analyzed: gacchan tiṣṭhan svapan bhuṃjan na anyat karma samācaret

analyzed: guroḥ gṛhe samakṣam vā na yathā iṣṭa āsanaḥ bhavet
translated: One should not sit as one pleases in the house of the guru or in his presence.

analyzed: guruḥ devaḥ yatas sākṣāt tat gṛham deva mandiram

analyzed: pāpinām ca yathā saṃgāt tad pāpāt patitaḥ bhavet

analyzed: yathā iha vahni saṃparkāt malam tyajati kāṃcanam
translated: Just as gold gives up its impurities by contact with fire,

analyzed: tathā eva guru saṃparkāt pāpam tyajati mānavaḥ

analyzed: yathā vahni samīpa sthaḥ ghṛta kumbhaḥ vilīyate
translated: Just as a pot of ghee melts in the proximity of fire,

analyzed: tathā pāpam vilīyeta hi ācāryasya samīpatas
translated: Similarly, the sin of the teacher would be dissolved in his presence.

original: yathā prajvalito vahniḥ śuṣkamārdraṃ ca nirdahet // / / //
analyzed: yathā prajvalitaḥ vahniḥ śuṣkam ārdram ca nirdahet
translated: Just as a blazing fire burns both the dry and the wet,

analyzed: tathā ayam api saṃtuṣṭaḥ guruḥ pāpam kṣaṇāt dahet

original: manasā karmaṇā vācā guroḥ krodhaṃ na kārayet // / / //
analyzed: manasā karmaṇā vācā guroḥ krodham na kārayet
translated: One should not arouse anger in the guru with mind, action, or speech.

analyzed: tasya krodhena dahyaṃte hi āyuḥ śrī jñāna satkriyāḥ

analyzed: tad krodha kāriṇaḥ ye syuḥ teṣām yajñāḥ ca niṣphalāḥ

analyzed: yamaḥ ca niyamāḥ ca eva na atra kāryā vicāraṇā

analyzed: guroḥ viruddham yat vākyam na vadet jātucit naraḥ

analyzed: vadet yadi mahā mohāt rauravam narakam vrajet

analyzed: manasā karmaṇā vācā gurum uddiśya yatnataḥ

original: śreyorthī cennaro dhīmānna mithyācāramācaret // / / //🔽gurorhitaṃ priyaṃ kuryādādiṣṭo vā na vā sadā // / / //
analyzed: śreyaḥ arthī ced naraḥ dhīmān na mithyā ācāram ācaret  guroḥ hitam priyam kuryāt ādiṣṭaḥ vā na vā sadā
translated: If a wise man desires what is good, he should not engage in false conduct.🔽One should always do what is beneficial and pleasing to the guru, whether commanded or not.

analyzed: guruḥ ced guṇavān prājñaḥ parama ānaṃda bhāsakaḥ

analyzed: na punar nāma mātreṇa saṃvid ārahitaḥ tu yaḥ

analyzed: yasya anubhava paryaṃtā buddhiḥ tattve pravartate

analyzed: gurum tam eva vṛṇuyāt na aparam matimān naraḥ

analyzed: sa śiṣyaiḥ vinaya ācāra caturaiḥ ucitaḥ guruḥ

analyzed: yāvat vijñāyate tāvat sevanīyaḥ mumukṣubhiḥ

analyzed: tasmin prasanne śiṣyasya sadyas pāpa kṣayaḥ bhavet

analyzed: dṛṣṭe tathā ānuśravike viraktam viṣaye manaḥ

analyzed: indriyāṇi prasaktāni yathāsvam viṣayeṣu iha

analyzed: sarvajñau satatam dhyeyau nānā rūpa vibhedataḥ

analyzed: dhyāna dvādaśakam yāvat samādhiḥ abhidhīyate

analyzed: samādhiḥ nnāma yoga aṃgam antimam parikīrtitam

analyzed: samādhinā ca sarvatra prajñā ālokaḥ pravartate

analyzed: yad artha mātra nirbhāsam stimitaḥ dadhi vat sthitam
translated: That which appears as mere object, remaining still like curd,

analyzed: svarūpa śūnya vat bhānam samādhiḥ abhidhīyate

analyzed: nirvāṇa anala vat yogī samādhi sthaḥ pragīyate

analyzed: evam śive vilīna ātmā samādhi sthaḥ iha ucyate

analyzed: tathā tasmāt na vicalet sudhīḥ

analyzed: evam abhyasataḥ cāram yoginaḥ yogam uttamam
translated: Thus, for the yogi who practices this excellent yoga,

analyzed: tad antarāyāḥ naśyanti vighnāḥ sarve śanais śanais

analyzed: atas gamiṣye ham avāpta kāmaḥ samastam eva astu śivam sadā naḥ  /

translated: When the blessings were offered to the charioteer and the great ritual was completed, the sages,

analyzed: kāle kalau ca viṣayaiḥ kaluṣāyamāṇe vārāṇasī parisare vasatim vinetuḥ

analyzed: atha ca te paśu pāśa mumukṣayā akhila tayā kṛta pāśupata vratāḥ

analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

analyzed: etat śiva purāṇam hi samāptam hitam ādarāt

original: paṭhitavyaṃ prayatnena śrotavyaṃ ca tathaiva hi // / / //
analyzed: paṭhitavyam prayatnena śrotavyam ca tathā eva hi

analyzed: nāstikāya na vaktavyam aśraddhāya śaṭhāya ca
translated: It should not be told to an atheist, to one without faith, or to a deceiver.

analyzed: abhaktāya maheśasya tathā dharmadhvajāya ca

analyzed: etad śrutyā hi eka vāram bhavet pāpam hi bhasmasāt

analyzed: abhaktaḥ bhaktim āpnoti bhaktaḥ bhakti samṛddhi bhāj
translated: One who is not a devotee attains devotion, and a devotee becomes prosperous with devotion.

analyzed: punar śrute ca sat bhaktiḥ muktiḥ syāt ca śruteḥ punar
translated: And by hearing it again, there would be good devotion, and liberation would come again by hearing it.

analyzed: tasmāt punar punar ca eva śrotavyam hi mumukṣubhiḥ
translated: Therefore, those who desire liberation should hear it again and again.

analyzed: pañcāvṛttiḥ prakartavyā purāṇasya asya sat dhiyā

original: paraṃ phalaṃ samuddiśya tatprāpnoti na saṃśayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: param phalam samuddiśya tat prāpnoti na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: purātanāḥ ca rājānaḥ viprāḥ vaiśyāḥ ca sattamāḥ
translated: The ancient kings, brahmins, and excellent vaishyas

analyzed: sapta kṛtvas tad āvṛttya alabhanta śiva darśanam

analyzed: śroṣyati atha api yaḥ ca idam mānavaḥ bhakti tatparaḥ
translated: And a man who listens to this with devotion

analyzed: iha bhuktvā akhilān bhogān ante muktim labhet ca saḥ
translated: Will enjoy all pleasures here and attain liberation in the end.

analyzed: etat śiva purāṇam hi śivasya ati priyam param
translated: This Shiva Purana is Shiva's greatest beloved

original: bhuktimuktipradaṃ brahmasaṃmitaṃ bhaktivardhanam // / / //🔽etacchivapurāṇasya vaktuḥ śrotuśca sarvadā // / / //🔽sagaṇassasutassāṃbaśśaṃ karotu sa śaṃkaraḥ // / / //

translated: It grants enjoyment and liberation, is equal to the Vedas, and increases devotion.🔽May that Shiva, along with his attendants, sons, and Ambika,🔽always bring about welfare to the expounder and listener of this Shiva Purana.

original: oṃ iti śrīśivamahāpurāṇe saptamyāṃ vāyavīyasaṃhitāyāmuttarakhaṇḍe vyāsopadeśaśrīśivamahāpurāṇamāhātmyavarṇanaṃ nāmaikacatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ🔽samāpto 'yaṃ granthaḥ

translated: Om. Thus ends the forty-first chapter in the Uttara Khanda of the Vayu Mahapurana, composed by the great sage Vayu.
